results.title: The Day off
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Derek Lamb and Sidney Goldsmith
results.brief_description: A day off allows us from routine existence, but it also prepares us for re-entering the workday world. In this animated film people relaxing on a beach are constantly being reminded of tragic events happening elsewhere. By the end of the day they are able to return to the real world and continue to ‘function’. (Awards: Melbourne)

results.title: The Day of the Triffids
results.brief_description: The few who retain their eyesight are horrified to see the Triffids normally small plants - grow to huge proportions as they become affected by the presence of the mysterious meteorites. As the Triffids multiply by the millions, they begin a march on civilisation, brutally destroying everyone in their path. Based on the book by John Wyndham. Rated: PG

results.title: The Day of the locust
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Long Road Productions, Jerome Hellman and John Schlesinger
results.brief_description: A scathing take on 1930s Hollywood motion picture industry, this film was only a moderate success at the time of release, despite garnering two Academy Award nominations. Adapted from Nathanael West’s novel the film principally charts the ambitions of Faye Greener (Karen Black), a talent-less starlet dreaming of fame, well beyond her grasp. In Faye’s orbit are Tod Hackett, a budding production designer and Homer Simpson, a wealthy suitor. Both men are driven mad by Faye’s excessive flirtations, yet stubborn unavailability. The narrative builds to a shocking climax. Music composed and conducted by John Barry.

results.title: The Day of the jackal [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Warwick Films, Universal Productions, Fred Zimmerman and John Woolf
results.brief_description: Based on the best seller by Frederick Forsyth, “The Day of the jackal” is a taut and colourful suspense thriller about the attempt by the right wing OAS to assassinate General De Gaulle. Edward Fox portrays the ruthless, anonymous assassin hired by OAS Chief Colonel Rodin, played by Eric Porter. The cold precision of his preparations is juxtaposed with the plodding efforts of the French authorities to uncover the plot.

results.title: The Day of the Concorde
results.brief_description: On 26 January 1976 Concorde carried its first paying passengers on a British Airways proving flight from Heathrow to Gander, Newfoundland. (An Air France Concorde took off at the same time, on a similar flight to Brazil.) This film captures this historic event, as the complement of VIP’s embark in the early morning and return in time for lunch.

results.title: The Day Jimmy's boa ate the wash
results.brief_description: A girl relates to her mother the bizarre chain of events that occurred as a result of Jimmy’s pet boa constrictor escaping during a class trip to a farm. Based on the book by Trinka Hakes Noble, illustrated by Steven Kellogg.

results.title: The Day begins
results.creator_credit: Keystone Film Company and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: Unable to play his part, Charlie is thrown out of the movie studio. In his efforts to return he disguises himself as a woman, causing havoc for the film crew and landing him in deep water ending with a chase through the Keystone sets. Cast includes Chester Conklin, Roscoe (Fatty) Arbuckle, Charles Murray.

results.title: The Day after trinity
results.creator_credit: KTEH-TV (Television station : San Jose, Calif.) and Jon Else
results.brief_description: A documentary on the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, focusing on his role in the development of the atomic bomb and the dramatic events preceding the world’s first atomic bomb explosion on July 16, 1945. A penetrating commentary on scientific inquiry, Oppenheimer’s fall from grace during the McCarthy era, and the tragedy of continuing nuclear proliferation.

results.title: The Day after tomorrow
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, University of the State of New York and Claire Taplin

Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Discusses the use of solar power, geothermal resources, and thermonuclear fusion as energy sources.
